IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO MAXIMIZE THE GIFT OF LIFE AND HEALTH THROUGH ORGAN, EYE, AND TISSUE DONATION.
IRS990.MissionDesc: NEVADA DONOR NETWORK (THE "NETWORK") IS A FEDERALLY DESIGNATED NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGAN, TISSUE, AND EYE PROCUREMENT ORGANIZATION. THE NETWORK IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE COORDINATION, RECOVERY, AND DISTRIBUTION OF DONATED HUMAN ORGANS AND TISSUES INTENDED FOR TRANSPLANTATION, MEDICAL EDUCATION AND RESEARCH. THE NETWORK PROVIDES SERVICES TO HOSPITALS AND HEALTHCARE FACILITIES THROUGHOUT NEVADA AND PARTICIPATES IN THE NATIONAL ORGAN AND TISSUE SHARING PROGRAM.
IRS990.Desc: ORGAN RECOVERY FOCUSES ON LIFE SAVING SOLID ORGANS SUCH AS THE HEART, LIVER, LUNGS, INTESTINES, PANCREAS AND KIDNEYS. ORGAN RECOVERY SUPPORTS THE SOLID ORGAN TRANSPLANT PROGRAMS AT UNIVERSITY MEDICAL CENTER AND OTHER TRANSPLANT PROGRAMS ACROSS THE COUNTRY.PROGRAM EXPENSES REPORTED ARE DIRECT EXPENSES ONLY AND DO NOT INCLUDE UNALLOCATED EXPENSES, SOME OF WHICH ARE REPORTED IN PROGRAM 4D BELOW.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: TISSUE AND EYE RECOVERY INCLUDES BONES, TENDONS, SKIN, HEART VALVES, VEINS AND CORNEAS. TISSUES ARE RECOVERED BY THE NETWORK STAFF AND SENT TO VARIOUS ORGANIZATIONS FOR FURTHER PROCESSING AND SUBSEQUENT DISTRIBUTION. THE NETWORK ALSO OPERATES A FULL SERVICE EYE BANK THAT PROVIDES OCULAR TISSUE FOR TRANSPLANTATION. OCULAR TISSUE IS UTILIZED LOCALLY AND SHARED WITH OTHER EYE BANKS THROUGHOUT THE UNITED STATES AND OTHER COUNTRIES THROUGH THE INTERNATIONAL CORNEA PROJECT. THIS ROGRAM INCLUDES THE NORTHERN NEVADA OFFICE THAT ALSO PERFORMS TISSUE AND EYE RECOVERY.PROGRAM EXPENSES REPORTED ARE DIRECT EXPENSES ONLY AND DO NOT INCLUDE UNALLOCATED EXPENSES, SOME OF WHICH ARE REPORTED IN PROGRAM 4D BELOW.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: THE HLA LABORATORY PERFORMS TISSUE TYPING ON POTENTIAL ORGAN DONORS, RECIPIENTS AND LIVING RELATED MATCHES.PROGRAM EXPENSES REPORTED ARE DIRECT EXPENSES ONLY AND DO NOT INCLUDE UNALLOCATED EXPENSES, SOME OF WHICH ARE REPORTED IN PROGRAM 4D BELOW.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: NEVADA DONOR NETWORK PROVIDES EDUCATION, AWARENESS AND INFORMATION TO THE MEDICAL COMMUNITY AND GENERAL PUBLIC THROUGH PROFESSIONAL EDUCATION SEMINARS, HOSPITAL IN-SERVICES, CEU PROGRAMS, PUBLIC EDUCATION, HEALTH FAIRS, BEREAVEMENT PROGRAMS, AND SCHOOL PRESENTATIONS.

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: BLACK KNIGHT SPORTS AND ENTERTAINMENT L

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NDN PAYS DUES TO THE ASSOCIATION OF ORGAN PROCUREMENT ORGANIZATION (AOPO), OF WHICH A SMALL PORTION IS USED FOR LOBBYING.

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: DUE TO/FROM NEVADA DONOR NETWORK FOUNDATION

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NEVADA DONOR NETWORK, INC., QUALIFIES AS A TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION UNDER SECTION 501 (C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (THE "CODE") AND, ACCORDINGLY, THERE IS NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES. IN ADDITION, THIS ENTITY QUALIFIES FOR THE CHARITABLE DEDUCTION UNDER SECTION 170 OF THE CODE AND HAVE BEEN CLASSIFIED AS AN ORGANIZATION THAT IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION. INCOME DETERMINED TO BE UNRELATED BUSINESS TAXABLE INCOME ("UBTI") WOULD BE TAXABLE. THE ORGANIZATION EVALUATES THEIR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS, IF ANY, ON A CONTINUAL BASIS THROUGH REVIEW OF THEIR POLICIES AND PROCEDURES, REVIEW OF THEIR REGULAR TAX FILINGS, AND DISCUSSIONS WITH OUTSIDE EXPERTS. THE ORGANIZATION BELIEVES THEY HAVE APPROPRIATE SUPPORT FOR ANY TAX POSITIONS TAKEN, AND AS SUCH, THEY DO NOT HAVE ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. THE ORGANIZATION'S FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL TAX RETURNS GENERALLY REMAIN OPEN FOR EXAMINATION BY THE VARIOUS TAXING AUTHORITIES FOR A PERIOD OF THREE TO SIX YEARS.
THE ORGANIZATION GIVES TO PRE-SELECTED CHARITIES THAT SUPPORT THE MISSION OF THE ORGANIZATION. NO FURTHER MONITORING IS CONSIDERED NECESSARY.
THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES TRAVEL FOR COMPANIONS TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. FORM 1099 IS ISSUED TO THE BOARD MEMBER IF THE $600 REPORTING THRESHOLD IS MET.

NEVADA DONOR NETWORK CONDUCTS A COMPENATION STUDY AT REGULAR INTERVALS, USING A THRID PARTY COMPENSATION CONSULTANT. CERTAIN EXECUTIVES HAVE WRITTED EMPLOYMENT CONTRACTS WHICH ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

THE DIRECTOR'S AND CEO'S BONUSES WERE ACCRUED BASED ON PRE-DETERMINED GOALS AND OBJECTIVES TIED TO PERFORMANCE METRICS. THE METRICS INCLUDE ORGANIZATIONAL NET INCOME AS WELL AS SPECIFIC STRATEGIC PLAN GOALS. THE BONUS IS A FIXED TARGET PERCENTAGE THAT INCLUDES A CAP. THE CFO AND COO BONUS PAID IS TIED TO PERFORMANCE METRICS AS WELL AS EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS SENT VIA EMAIL AND REGULAR MAIL TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS A POLICY ON CORPORATE COMPLIANCE THAT ALL EMPLOYEES, MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING AND ADVISORY BOARDS AND MEMBERS OF THEIR IMMEDIATE HOUSEHOLD MUST DISCLOSE ANY ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AND ABSTAIN FROM ANY ACTION OR VOTE INVOLVING THE DISCLOSED POTENTIAL OR ACTUAL CONFLICT. TRAINING IS DONE ON AN ANNUAL BASIS FOR BOTH EMPLOYEES AND BOARD MEMBERS AND ALL SIGN-OFF THAT THEY UNDERSTAND AND WILL ADHERE TO POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL WAGES AND BENEFITS ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES USING AN INDEPENDENT THIRD PARTY SALARY STUDY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST FOR THE SAME PERIOD OF DISCLOSURE AS SET FORTH IN SECTION 6104(D).
